meanings.definition: To provide the money for a project or enterprise.
meanings.sent1: She is bankrolling the school play to ensure it can happen.
meanings.sent2: The generous donor is bankrolling the construction of the new library.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a lemonade stand being bankrolled by a squirrel is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for education is bankrolling dreams for many students.
meanings.sent5: The image of a piggy bank rolling down the street symbolizes bankrolling in a whimsical way.

meanings.sent1: The government is bankrolling the research on renewable energy sources.
meanings.sent2: Investors are bankrolling the startup company to help it grow.
meanings.sent3: The notion of a talking parrot bankrolling a pirate ship is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her determination is bankrolling her journey towards success.
meanings.sent5: The river flowing with coins vividly illustrates the concept of bankrolling.
